    Estimating Expenses Estimating Market Size Estimating Total Revenue

    Estimating Total Revenue

    Est-Total-Revenue.Rmd
    library(DSPGGrocery)

    Estimating Revenue

    For revenue estimation, we need the average spending per capita and the number of shoppers in each category (Primary, Secondary, Rare) for each type of market (Metro, Rural, Town).

    Average Per Capita Grocery Spend

    The Avg_Capita_Grocery_Spending() function calculates the average per capita spending. The 2022 total US grocery sales data is taken from IBIS and divided by the 2022 total US population from the US Census Bureau. Since the population and grocery sales have taken 2022 data, we must account for the change for the current year. This is adjusted by the functions Adj_Capita_Grocery_Spend() and State_Adj_Capita_Grocery_Spend() using CPI (Consumer Price Index) and RPP (Rural Price Parities), respectively. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a measure of the average change over time in the prices paid by urban consumers for a market basket of consumer goods and services. So, adjusting according to the CPI accounts for the inflation in the US. Regional price parities (RPP) measure the differences in price levels across states and metropolitan areas for a given year and are expressed as a percentage of the overall national price level. Adjusting according to this measure gives that state’s average per capita spending on groceries for that year. ## Total Spend by Category The next component needed for estimating the revenue is the number of shoppers in each category for each type of market. We classify shoppers into 3 categories: Primary Shoppers: The people doing most of the household grocery shopping. Secondary Shoppers: Rare Shoppers: People who are very occasional shoppers. We classify shoppers into 3 different populations: Metro: The population of the city in which the store is planned to open Town: Population of all the cities in the market Rural: Total rural population of the market The functions: Primary_Shopper_Count(), Secondary_Shopper_Count(), and Rare_Shopper_Count() calculates the number of shoppers in each category for each type of market. The outputs of these functions are used in calculating the total spend by each of these groups by Total_Spend_Primary_Shoppers(), Total_Spend_Secondary_Shoppers(), and Total_Spend_Rare_Shoppers() functions.

    For information on data update frequency and sources, check out this table:

    Total Revenue Estimate

    Total revenue is estimated by summing the total spend by primary, secondary, and rare shoppers.
